column4: help.  I have a machine that will not do a an apt-get upgrade.
It simpley stops when trying to install openssh-client.
questions like that need to be accompanied by the full apt error, /etc/apt/sources.list and a description of what you're trying to do
I'm using the hoary repos nothing unofficial.
where you didn't elaborate on it either
btw, I'm chrooted into the box via Knoppix at the moment.
I still have no idea what you're talking about
blank line is not a useful description
no. errors no further information.  apt simply hangs there.
sorry for not being very descriptive.
I can cancel out of apt, with a <ctrl>-C, but nothing happens.
